program-appdesign.name: Prisoner Express App Design
program-appdesign.author: Lyss Eng
program-appdesign.about: No prior design experience required! This packet focuses on the creative design process of app creation. We will cover the life cycle of the human-centered design process, from user research to design and prototyping.

program-chess.name: Prisoner Express Chess Club
program-chess.author: Raheem 725
program-chess.about: New to chess or a seasoned expert? No matter what background you have, this chess packet will satisfy your interest in the sport. In this packet, you will review the basics and special moves, read about historic tournaments and players, and practice with some chess challenges.

program-med.name: Meditation and Spirituality
program-med.author: Tara
program-med.about: This packet contains information about various practices in meditation, its benefits, advice, a list of resources, and more. Begin or continue your journey to soothe and sharpen your mind in new ways.

program-art.name: Artknows
program-art.author: Lee Cotman
program-art.about: Welcome to ARTknows! In this edition we are going to explore the art of couples. There have been famous couples in all walks of life throughout history; political couples such as Cleopatra and Julius Caesar (or was it Mark Anthony, or both?) or singing couples such as Tina and Ike Turner. How about visual fine art couples?

poetry-28.name: Poetry Anthology #28
poetry-28.about: We are constantly receiving and reading poetry submissions from the prisoners in our program. It is always a pleasure to be able to appreciate and enjoy the creativity of these talented poets. We are proud to provide them with a platform to have their voices heard. Join us in our 28th celebration of poetry submissions from these authors.

poetry-27.name: Poetry Anthology #27
poetry-27.about: Join us in our 27th celebration of poetry submissions from these authors. Once again, I would like to thank everyone who submitted poetry as well as all of the volunteers and staff at Prisoner Express for their hard work.

poetry-26.name: Poetry Anthology #26
poetry-26.about: Over the past several months, hundreds of poems have poured in from across the country. These works explore love and loss, the fleeting nature of memory, and personal transformation, among other themes. Weâ€™ve compiled many of the poems into this anthology, which has been mailed out to every person in prison who has gone through the challenging process of submitting their work.
